bibliographic_metadata.Title: Mapping prospectivity for regolith-hosted REE deposits via convolutional neural network with generative adversarial network augmented data
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Tong Li, Renguang Zuo, Xinfu Zhao, Kuidong Zhao

abstract: This study proposed a convolutional neural network (CNN) architecture to integrate multi-source data (geological, geochemical, and geomorphological) to map mineral prospectivity of regolith-hosted REE deposits. A generative adversarial network (GAN) was applied for data augmentation to address the lack of labeled data. The CNN achieved 99.7% training accuracy and 98.9% validation accuracy, successfully locating all known mineral deposits within the prospective areas delineated by the CNN.
methodology: supervised > deep learning > convolutional neural network (CNN); knowledge-driven > probabilistic > weights of evidence (WofE)
key_points: Proposed a CNN architecture for mineral prospectivity mapping.
Utilized GAN for data augmentation to address data scarcity.
Achieved high training and validation accuracy.
Successfully located known mineral deposits within delineated prospective areas.
